_sText:
Poseidon - Sniper War
Made by Foofinoo


In the midst of modern times, a fierce conflict erupts between the followers of the Greek deity Poseidon and the worshippers of his Roman counterpart Neptune.

A clash of ancient beliefs unfolds as the two factions engage in a heated clan war within the hallowed walls of the deity's sanctuary.

The battle opposing Poseidon and Neptune's devotees rages on, echoing the timeless rivalry between the Greek and Roman pantheons.


After my last map DE_Gossamer, which was pretty long and exhausting to make, I wanted to move on to something simpler and more modest.

I'd been wanting to do it for some time, so I set about remaking an AWP map.
I love the concept of AWP maps because they allow me to develop a strong concept in a fairly small environment without getting too hung up on a layout that has to be somewhat refined and balanced to be fun.

In short, my heart fell on the map AWP_Poseidon by Hemingway.
I always loved the simplicity of this map, the theme, the colours, the ambiance... So I thought it would be perfect to come back with this new map.

Since everything is very clean and there are not really extra adornments on the original map, I focused a lot on the textures so that the whole thing fits together perfectly, while using only custom assets to make the map look really unique.
Of course, for the models, sounds and a few textures, I had to use those from the mod INFRA developed by Loiste Interactive.
The rest of the textures come from the website Textures.com, and the water texture was made by wohSiesta.

I also took the liberty of decorating the map with several pictorial representations of Poseidon to dress up the walls.
In addition, I always wondered how the players would get to the area in the first place, so I have added doors as well on both sides of the map.
These are pretty much the only notable differences between the original map and my remake.

That said, making the map took a lot longer than I'd hoped.
In retrospect, building the map itself went fairly quickly, but it was choosing the textures and making sure everything lined up properly that took the longest.
I went back and forth on the models and textures countless times because I really wanted everything to be as good and clean as possible.

I actually started to work on the map at the beginning of September 2023.
But unlike my previous ones, I've really given myself plenty of time.
Sometimes, several months would go by between two sessions of work - which is really huge for me, as I usually work almost "in one go".
Yet this kind of map allows it, so it wasn't too much of a hindrance and it was actually quite nice to be able to come and go when I really wanted to.

According to my backups, I didn't touch the map from December to February, and again in April.
But it was truly starting to drag, so I took advantage of the many public holidays in May to really get back to it and add the final touches at that time.
I even managed to add a little easter egg (yes, I'm a child).

Anyway, it's getting to be a lot of words for such a small map and I don't even know if anyone actually reads what I write, so I'll just end here...
Have fun!


Foofinoo
June 10, 2024
